intro: Polygala collina, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish in color. Polygala collina is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
